title: Puns: The Write Stuff
content: OK, so in the mood for some Monday morning typographic silliness. Any one bold enough to oblige?
author: alyce

comments.content:
In the early stages of my infatuation with   
type I tried to come up with some good names   
for design companies which pun on typefaces,   
so just imagine:   
   
"Hello, akzidenz will happen."   
   
There were others, thankfully forgotten.

In my font catalogue I included 'writing and wronging' as a font sample.   
   
At design school, whenever something was crooked or askew we'd call it 'oblique'. Like 'That picture is slightly oblique'.

Ahh, the wonders of the new technologies. We were not moving quickly enough as typographers in the handset or machine set era so we got photo set�but, not until the digital era, could we really get the lead out.   
   
Chris

I had a mate who would get drunk and   
claim he was feeling "all kerned out!"

Just got it. "Anyone BOLD enough to oblige."   
Ha!
'all kerned out' ha ha ha.

Gentlemen, you are the type showing yourselves to be true men of character. (In times Roman you would have been crowned with laurel leaves.) Thanks for getting the point; thanks for starting this thread off on the right track.

I shot the serif.   
   
Marley/Clapton will never sound the same.

Here's a few that we did while I was at EyeWire back in 1998.

Grant, LOL!
I got a million more of 'em on a disk somewhere too. We spent an entire afternoon thinking 'em up. I must post the rest of them someday.
Looks like Grant has the metal for the job
I can't keep track of all the kerns we've taken to make our case in California�what a job!
I don't know if I've \*lead\* a full enough life to \*justify\* having the \*metal\*...
LOL! You at least have flushed out enough to run them ragged :-)

I Rotis just for Typophile...   
   
I Meta man one time. I said, "Avenir seen you somewhere before?"   
   
"I was a famous Centaur once. Joanna know what happened? Italia what happened. The Air Force took a Janson me. They put me in charge of Arial maneuvers. The DIN was terrible. I said 'Avant Gardes posted Ronda clock!' They said, 'This Stymie went too far.' Well, no more Beton Ronda bush. I made some Eras. They cost me my Courier. Univers see it until it's too late. Bodoni hurts when I laugh. Now, I spend my Times Roman the streets."   
   
I wondered Weidemann was saying all these crazy things.   
   
Franklin, I don't give a Dom.   
   
(My apologies. Please don't Melior comments to me.)

Tears in my eyes, man! :-\>\>   
   
hhp

Mark --   
   
Well done, man! Fabulous!   
   
-- K.
LOL, Mark! A million bonus picas, er points, to you.
(Grant, I still miss Eyewire.)
Myriad a little lamb... I'd better quit while I'm ahead. :-)

sweet stuff Mark!   
A person's gotta [Espresso](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051302/http:/www.myfonts.com/)   
what's on their mind.

I had to look very carefully at him before I saw the smile.
